qas.question: What flaw in the 'war on terror' name did Francis Fukuyama point out?

answers.text: "terrorism" is not an enemy, but a tactic

qas.question: What does the 'war on terror' name obscure?

answers.text: differences between conflicts such as anti-occupation insurgents and international mujahideen

qas.question: Who said the US's presence in Iraq increases resentment and terrorists?
What fed US hysteria about terrorism?
What has the 'war on terror' done to the US's international image?
What does Shirley Williams call terrorism instead of an enemy?
Who said the military presence has decreased resentment?

plausible_answers.text: hypocrisy, media-induced hysteria, and that differences in foreign and security policy

qas.question: What has damaged the image of Iraq in the world?
What critic obscured differences between conflicts?
Most of the world has agreed on what kinds of policies?
